title: Adigvcdh
author: Adigvcdh
content: Tell me how to promote the token? And which exchanges have the cheapest listing?

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? And which exchanges have the cheapest listing?You can start a bounty campaign, make referral system, give advertisement to well known news sites etc.If you are looking for exchanges with cheap listing then that means you don't really believe in your project. Good projects get listed without even giving any money to exchanges. Your impression you made here is that you have a copycat coin that you want to sell ignorant people to get rich quick.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? And which exchanges have the cheapest listing?So, what kind of token are we talking about here? Is there a real use case for it, or is it more of an idea without a product behind it? The first step would be to introduce the concept and your product to the relevant community, like the one here.  If the idea is solid and the token actually serves a purpose, it should gain traction naturally. Or are we talking about yet another useless "pump-and-dump" kind of shitcoin here?

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? And which exchanges have the cheapest listing?You can have like signature or bounty campaigns, or have like twitter and other social media campaign here in the community. You can hire someone to take care of it for you.Go to this board to have an idea on how to promote here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=238.0As for the exchange, not sure about it, maybe you have to go to some exchange and ask them directly. Of course, if you are looking for the cheapest, then most likely it could be just second tier exchanges.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? And which exchanges have the cheapest listing?Are you kidding right now,  because I have not heard anything like listing fees for exchange for a long while now,  I thought coins/tokens get listed without any fees and in most cases what is required for the coin to get listed on too big exchanges is the coin potentials and the ability to prove to exchange that it will be a good project if and when listed. Any exchange that takes fees from projects to list their coins is not legit at all since scam projects could easily pay the fees just to get their coin listed and thereafter do an exit scam on the coin holders.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Some exchanges including binance list coins or tokens for free if the project is so good and is not scam after being subjected to their eligibility criteria. The question is what is the internet of your project? Or is it one of those which is created to make money off other users?Another way is to gain traction through the likes of Uniswap, pancakeswap and if your project attracts enough numbers or hype then it would catch the attention of Big exchanges.

comments.author: DabsPoorVersion
comments.body: You can do ads, referral, conduct a bounty campaign which includes social media campaign (youtube, twitter, facebook, tiktok, etc.). There's actually a lot of ways to do token promotion, it will surely gather investors as long as the idea or use of the token. And of course, the number of investors will always depends on how people see the potential of your token.

comments.author: Hildentine
comments.body: I think many projects promote there project and they use different platform for promotion some time project announced Airdrop and they launch a bounty project many user work there and promote there project.

comments.author: Kemarit
comments.body: Quote from: Wiwo on September 02, 2023, 10:04:44 PMQuote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? And which exchanges have the cheapest listing?Are you kidding right now,  because I have not heard anything like listing fees for exchange for a long while now,  I thought coins/tokens get listed without any fees and in most cases what is required for the coin to get listed on too big exchanges is the coin potentials and the ability to prove to exchange that it will be a good project if and when listed. Top exchanges as far I know, charges huge amount to get them listed, again, if my memory serves me right,  could be around 1 BTC. But this is way back around 2017-2018. So for sure listing in top exchanges like Binance could have hefty sum of money.Quote from: Wiwo on September 02, 2023, 10:04:44 PMAny exchange that takes fees from projects to list their coins is not legit at all since scam projects could easily pay the fees just to get their coin listed and thereafter do an exit scam on the coin holders. Exchanges take fees because it's business though, I mean it's like they are the facilitator, so as a project, you will used their name to have your coin on them. So it's mutually exclusive, exchanges facilitate you pay them, you used their trading platform. Your project them will be exposed to traders.Maybe in the beginning, this project doesn't have any money to list to top exchange that's why they chooses the cheapest, but for me, this is not good practice.Better to start your foot in a good exchange regardless of the fees because for sure you can get it back.

comments.author: shinratensei_
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? You can promote your token through various ways. There have been some answers like making your own campaign in this forum. You can also start to build engagement to the public by offering incentive task for anyone who participated in your campaign. There are some like zealy or something else which will also help you in increasing the engagement from your project to the public. You can consider this as one of option to promote your token. Listing your token to the exchange site can also give you a lot of demands to your tokens. Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMAnd which exchanges have the cheapest listing?[/b]As far as i know that the cheapest exchange site must be dex. You just need to provide liquidity for that. If this belong to the cex and my answer will be MEXC

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? The popular one is through bounty in the forum. comments.author: Oneandpure
comments.body: For promoting token or coin have many ways from Bounty campaign, airdrop, Testnet, give away in twitter social media until you can try with retro process for promoting your token. But most effective how to promote your token need spent budget and advertising on website are more popular in cryptocurrency like advertise with Coinmarketcap website banner. Looking for exchange with cheapest listing seems LBANK or exchange with medium level.Actually I like with token listing in Hotbit but this exchange have stop operation and looks Gate.io are similar exchange like Hotbit and have cheapest listing fees than bigger exchange like Binance, Huobi or Kucoin. Better advertising for promoting your coins and easily become popular than promoting trough bounty campaign or airdrop way.

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh  on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? And which exchanges have the cheapest listing?The easiest way will be through exchanges although they cost money,  a lot of it I'd say. I doubt there's any exchange that would accept cheap fees,  so just expect it to be rather costly.  I looked it up and topmost result says small exchanges charge a minimum of $6k, max of $30k.  It'd probably be better to look for it yourself but that should give you a frame of sorts to work with.Another way is through social media. With how it's grown, it's reach can affect a LOT of people if done properly, so I suggest hiring a manager for that. This can cost less or more than listing your token in an exchange depending on how much visibility you want your token to have. I'd say hire some shit posters if you really want it to be cheap, but hey, cheap solutions come with cheap results.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token?Hire a bounty manager, and a marketing manager and let them handle the rest. This is applicable if you have the budget and all the means to do it but if not, you can be your own man team. But the best strategy is to get known through social media but I hope that the project you're about to work and advertise with isn't a scam.Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMAnd which exchanges have the cheapest listing?I'm not sure but there are plenty of them. There are even those exchanges that won't require you any fee as long as you've got a good community that will support the project and listing can be done through voting.

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? And which exchanges have the cheapest listing?Social media promotion, paid advertisements in social media platforms, thru bounty campaigns here in the forum. Right now, these are the things that I know companies are using when they want to promote their project. The first 2 that I said is the most commonly used. The 3rd one? Yes as well as we've seen many bounty campaigns coming out on a weekly basis, but I still believe that there are many more companies who are maximizing the popularity of social media platforms such as Youtube, Facebook, and X (Twitter) right now, and using it to advertise their project, and to scam people as well. Which exchanges have the cheapest listing? I don't know which exchanges, but I believe those unpopular ones are the ones who are offering token listing for a cheaper price compare to larger, and more popular ones like Binance, and Kucoin etc.

comments.author: benalexis12
comments.body: The first question that is most important of all is: how much allocation budget do you have for the token? What is the token for, what are its uses, and why do you have to buy it? There are many things you can do to promote the token, referral programs are one of them, or if you are not that familiar with the industry of the crypto space, you can hire reputable managers here on the forum like @Hampuz, @Royse777, @icopress, @sujonali1819, @Trofo, @julerz12, @LittleMouse, and others,  just contact which of them you like. As for exchanges, there are many options you can choose from, and that really depends on the budget or funding your project has.

comments.author: abel1337
comments.body: Quote from: Adigvcdh on September 02, 2023, 06:59:32 PMTell me how to promote the token? And which exchanges have the cheapest listing?As others say, bounty campaign is the cost effective and easiest way to promote here and outside this forum. You will pay your participants at your own chosen payment options. Bounty hunters are more interested on rewards with value, for sure your bounty campaign will have a lot of participants if you choose a campaign which offers fiat payment. Another method is by utilizing social media, post some promotions on various social medias. I don't have any idea of the current pricing of centralize exchange listing fees but as far as I know, listing it on decentralize exchange is way cheaper but you have to provide liquidity for your token.
